# How to Use GPS Tracker Parameter Editor v1.39 to Configure Your Device
 
If you are looking for a software tool that can help you set up and customize your GPS tracker device, you might want to check out GPS Tracker Parameter Editor v1.39. This is a free and easy-to-use program that allows you to modify various parameters of your GPS tracker, such as the frequency of data transmission, the sensitivity of the motion sensor, the alarm settings, and more. In this article, we will show you how to download, install, and use GPS Tracker Parameter Editor v1.39 to configure your device.
 
## What is GPS Tracker Parameter Editor v1.39?
 
GPS Tracker Parameter Editor v1.39 is a software tool that can be used to edit the configuration files of various GPS tracker models, such as TK102, TK103, TK104, TK106, GT02A, GT06N, GT06E, GT07, GT08, GT09, GT10, GT20B, GT30i, GT60, and more. The software can be downloaded from [this link](https://www.gps-tracker.com/gps-tracker-parameter-editor-v139/) for free.

## How to Use GPS Tracker Parameter Editor v1.39 to Configure Your Device?
 
To use GPS Tracker Parameter Editor v1.39 to configure your device, follow these steps:

1. Connect your GPS tracker device to your computer using a USB cable or a serial port adapter.
2. Select the correct COM port from the drop-down menu at the top left corner of the software.
3. Click on the "Read" button at the top right corner of the software to read the current parameters of your device.
4. You will see a list of parameters on the left side of the software and their values on the right side. You can modify any parameter by clicking on it and typing a new value or selecting an option from a drop-down menu.
5. Some of the most common parameters that you might want to change are:
    - "Upload Interval": This determines how often your device sends its location data to the server or your phone. You can set it from 10 seconds to 24 hours.
    - "Motion Sensor": This determines how sensitive your device is to movement. You can set it from 0 (off) to 255 (very sensitive).
    - "Alarm Settings": This determines what actions your device takes when it detects an alarm condition, such as low battery, SOS button press, geo-fence breach, overspeeding, etc. You can set it to send an 8cf37b1e13
